body:
**Day 1 of 10: DONE** âœ…

Built an autonomous portfolio manager that understands plain English and executes on Solana.

## What Works Now

**Natural Language â†’ Intent â†’ Execution**

```
"swap 0.1 SOL to USDC"      â†’ âœ… Swap via Jupiter
"deposit 100 USDC"          â†’ âœ… Lend on Kamino
"check my USDC position"    â†’ âœ… Show position + APY
"withdraw 50 USDC"          â†’ âœ… Withdraw from vault
```

## Architecture

User Command â†’ Parser â†’ Risk Check â†’ Executor â†’ Protocol

- Custom NLP parser (intent detection)
- Risk manager (limits, validation)
- Jupiter V6 integration (swaps)
- Kamino integration (lending)
- Jito staking (Day 2)

## What Makes It Agentic

Most projects: User â†’ decides â†’ clicks â†’ executes âŒ

TreasuryAgent: User â†’ speaks â†’ agent decides â†’ executes âœ…

No technical knowledge required. Just tell it what you want.

## Demo

```bash
git clone https://github.com/fran011245/treasury-agent.git
npm install
npm start

> check balance
> swap 0.01 SOL to USDC
> deposit 50 USDC
```

## Day 2 Plan
- Test Jupiter on devnet with real transactions
- Integrate real Kamino SDK (currently mocked)
- Add Jito staking
- Demo video prep

## Looking for Collaborations

If you're building:
- Lending protocols (beyond Kamino)
- Staking solutions
- Yield aggregators
- SDKs for protocol access

Let's integrate. TreasuryAgent can be your execution layer.
